headline: Will FICO’s New Program Force Equifax (EFX) to Rethink Its Competitive Edge in Mortgages?
summary: In recent days, Fair Isaac Corporation (FICO) introduced the Mortgage Direct License Program, allowing mortgage lenders and resellers to access FICO credit scores directly, bypassing established credit bureaus such as Equifax. This development marks a structural change in how credit scores are distributed in the mortgage industry, raising questions about future revenue streams for traditional credit bureaus and signaling heightened competition in the sector. Now, we'll examine how the...
